name: ssex

stmt.origin: sylbi(wss(c0, c1), wcel(c0, universe), wceq(cin(c0, c1), c0))

body.origin:
|- wi(wss(c0, c1), wcel(c0, universe))
-| wb(wss(c0, c1), wceq(cin(c0, c1), c0))
-| wi(wceq(cin(c0, c1), c0), wcel(c0, universe))

stmt.pretty: mpbii((c0 ⋂ c1)= c0, c0 ∈ 𝕌, (c0 ⋂ c1)∈ 𝕌)

body.origin:
|- wi(wceq(cin(c0, c1), c0), wcel(c0, universe))
-| wcel(cin(c0, c1), universe)
-| wi(wceq(cin(c0, c1), c0), wb(wcel(cin(c0, c1), universe), wcel(c0, universe)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wss(c0, c1), wcel(c0, universe))

-| wi(wceq(cin(c0, c1), c0), wb(wcel(cin(c0, c1), universe), wcel(c0, universe)))

-| wi(wceq(cin(c0, c1), c0), wb(wcel(cin(c0, c1), universe), wcel(c0, universe)))
-| wcel(c1, universe)

body.origin: |- wi(wceq(cin(c0, c1), c0), wb(wcel(cin(c0, c1), universe), wcel(c0, universe)))

comment: The subset of a set is also a set. Exercise 3 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 22. This is one way to express the Axiom of Separation ~ ax-sep (a.k.a. Subset Axiom). (Contributed by NM, 27-Apr-1994.)
